page.title: 13Customs in Heald Green.
page.content: A couple of weeks before Christmas, on the grass near the library, the Council put up a big Christmas Tree. We have a crib put up later by the Ratepayers' Association. The crib has some animals in it and Mary,Joseph and Jesus, and some hay. When it comes to Christmas Eve about 400 people gather round the tree to sing carols. The Vicar from St.Catherine's Church says all the prayers. There is always a brass band to accompany the singing. Altogether it is a very nice evening. Another custom is the annual Rose Queen Festival. It is a happy occasion when the Rose Queen and other children in beautiful costumes and dresses parade round the roads accompanied by a band. The Queen is crowned at St.Catherine's Church and then there is a party for everyone.
